titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies Collection of Related Documents and Ephemera
Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies Collection of Related Documents and Ephemera
titlestmt.author: Stephen Naron and Manuscripts and Archives staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:17

did.unittitle: Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies collection of related documents and ephemera

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection includes original and facsimile documents, photographs, manuscripts, clippings and other items related to individuals who have given testimony to the Fortunoff Video Archive.

langmaterial.language: The materials are in English, Russian, Yiddish, Hebrew, Spanish, and other European languages.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Material donated to the Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies. Transferred to Manuscripts and Archives, 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Use of these materials will require registration at Yale's Manuscripts and Archives. As is the case with other materials from the Fortunoff Video Archive, permission to view these materials is not the same a permission to publish or cite from these materials. Any citation of individual items from this collection must use the "cite as" field in the corresponding catalog record (see Associated Materials). Only the first letter of the survivor's surname is used to protect that person's anonymity.

Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies Collection of Related Documents and Ephemera (MS 1913). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Each survivor that contributed materials to this collection has a corresponding video testimony in the Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies. Each testimony is represented in Orbis, Yale's online public access catalog, with a bibliographic record associated with the testimonies HVT# (Holocaust Video Testimony) -- the unique identifier used to locate testimonies in the Fortunoff Video Archive. These records contain a brief summary of the tesitmony and several Library of Congress subject headings, both topical and geographic. To locate the corresponding bibliographic record in Orbis, you will need to conduct a keyword search for "hvt-#" (including the quotation marks), i.e. "hvt 30".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes original and facsimile documents, photographs, manuscripts, clippings and other items related to individuals who have given testimony to the Fortunoff Video Archive.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized in ascending order by HVT #, which is the unique identifier employed by the Fortunoff Video Archive for Holocaust Testimonies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains personal narrative book chapters entitled "Baluty," "Leaving the Ghetto," "Liberation," "Living in the Ghetto," "Our Neighborhood," "Pinchow," "The Lodz Ghetto," and "Wajnberg Bakery."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains narrative concerning Kristallnacht.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains translation of diary; identification cards from United States Holocaust Memorial Museum of Selma E.'s relatives; and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs of Hela S.'s family.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs of Walter S. and survivors of Buchenwald; newspaper clippings; photocopy of identification card and certification; letter of verification by H.E. Wortsmith of the 6th A. Div C.I.C.; speech by Walter S.; and a copy of an interview of Walter S. by Donald M. Douglas followed by a copy of a testimony by Walter S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a newspaper article about Daniel F.'s liberation from Dachau and his reuniting with Rainbow Division liberator Morris Eisenstein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of leaflet included for a conference that has a short biography of Karl S; and a copy of a drawing showing where Karl S. hid for eighteen months as a child in southeast Poland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter from Baruch G. to Dana L. Kline on his reflections on the 50th anniversary of the end of WWII, and a bound copy of Baruch G.'s memoir covering his life from 1939-1995.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letters from Van Jeffreys Frankel, James Young, John Van Doren, Susan Broockman, Eve Tahmincioglu, Peter Sherm, and family members to Nadia P.; a letter to Joanne Rudof; poetry by Hilan Dov Warshaw; and narratives by Michael P.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a program for a memorial celebration of Ilse Johanna Hess.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains published booklet of six lectures on the Holocaust by Lilli K., Emory University Center for Research in Social Change.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an English and German copy of an affidavit given in the Office of the Liberated Jews in Munich describing treatment by the Boryslaw Police, and a newspaper clipping.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a poem by Nicholas P., and a narrative about the liberation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter to Hariette Friedlander; a narrative and autobiography by Sydney S.; copies of maps; photocopies of various identifications and certifications; photocopy of identification booklet cover for Joseph Friedman; brief biography of E. Herschkovits; photocopied photographs of Jews in Hungarian labor camps; 1942 hospital notice forbidding entry of diseased individuals; and a photocopy of a photograph of a mass grave in Bergen-Belsen camp on the day of liberation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clipping with quotes from Abraham S. about the Fortunoff Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two copies of physician order issued by the Organization of Physicians of Vienna.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains narrative by Frieda G.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letter written in 1945 by William K. to his parents; poetry by William K.; and two narratives by William K.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains transcript of Esther A.'s testimony given at the Yad Vashem at the gathering of Holocaust survivors in Jerusalem, June 14-18, 1981.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains article about William F. written by the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains clippings; a personal narrative; a newspaper article on Meta N.'s passing; and a copy of a play based on some of Meta N.'s Holocaust experiences.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photo of Coen R.; a newspaper aritcle about Coen R.; and Coen R.'s war report written from 1945 to 1949, in Amsterdam, for the War Documentation Center of the Netherlands. (523 pages).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photos; identity card copies; copy of a letter verifying work status; and a copy of address papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a personal narrative regarding Margrit R.'s Holocaust experiences in Theresienstadt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an announcement of Julia P.'s photography exhibit at Quinnipiac College in Connecticut; contains newspaper clippings about the exhibit; and a memo suggesting that Joanne Rudof visit the exhibit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two memoirs by David P. about his experiences in the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains three personal narratives about Mary M.'s experiences during the Holocaust; two self-relfective works about her memories/experiences; and a letter to Mrs. Schiff regarding "Operation Bowl of Soup" in the Warsaw Ghetto.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains presentation speech given by Pierre T. to the United States Holocaust Memorial Council regarding non-Jews who were persecuted by the Nazis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains narrative about Solomon S.'s experiences during the Holocaust as well as family history, including photographs, historical birth record, and a family tree.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a family history of Gaston S.'s family including a "current residence" list of living family members and relevant narrative information for those family members who were affected by the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two songs sung in concentration camps (one copy of "Das Judenlied" and two copies of "In Thuringer Land").

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of a "Lucie to the Rescue" French undergound resistance movement comic; school identification card; correspondence from 1945-1947; a police order dated September 17, 1942; an "Acte De Disparition" for Fanny Ettinger dated 1947; and an interview intake form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains English and German copies of a letter to Reichsfuehrer-SS H. Himmler requesting the transfer of the scientific section in Concentration Camp Plaszow to Concentration Camp Flossenbrueck to continue the work of the Institute for the German Eastwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of published reviews of Henry O.'s book, I Shall Live , copies of German documents related to Henry O.'s experiences and English translations of them, copy of a Ravensbr√ºck registry with the names of Henry O. and his brothers; and comments on his book from educators.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an article from the Washingtonian entitled "When Dad Needed Me," by Fred O.'s son, J.B., about his father's life experiences during the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Russian language copies of letters and identification cards from October and November of 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a biographical essay by Margarete L.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Yiddish poetry by Frances B. about her experiences, including some English translations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains English memoir by Murray B. and a copy of an article from the September 7, 1968 Yiddish Forward .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains German language biography of Ilse L.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a personal narrative/academic paper by Leokadis W. on the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a short biography of Stanley O.; documentation of his time in the Polish military; copies of his false identification papers; and newspaper clippings on Stanley O.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clipping on Luna K.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clipping on Wolf Z.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains one issue of Windshejmer Lager-Biuletin , a newspaper of Windsheimer Displaced Persons Camp (issue number 10), printed in Yiddish in Roman alphabet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains police permits for members of Claire H.'s family; statement that Claire H.'s family received information and declaration of property sheets; memos and instructions of the Secret Police regarding the evacuation of Jewish residents; and a brief registry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings about Edmund M.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains articles and reviews of book and play based on book, Fragments of Isabella .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a narrative by Janet R. (nee Zenia Esienberg), taken from the Ostrog Book, about her family; and a Yiddish writ, published in 1954 in Argentina, by a survivor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains various correspondence from World ORT Union; identifcation papers for Imre Weiser's employment at the ORT Central Headquarters in Germany; driving certificate for Imre Weiser from the Preparatory Commission for the International Refugee Organization; a recommendation letter for Imre Weiser; Notification of Personnel Action for Imre Weiser; Certificate of Authority for Displaced Persons for Imre Weiser; a copy of the June 26, 1949 Hersey Herald; and a document in Hebrew.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Felix F.'s resume, and a copy of the Paparim Dance Ensemble Newsletter which features a piece on Felix F.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a memoir by Freida Z., titled "Searching for Shadows," about her trip to Warsaw, Birkenau, and Auschwitz.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a portion of the narrative, published as a series by Emunah Women of America, Committee on the Holocaust, by Sarah W. about her experiences in Luxembourg, Marseilles, and Switzerland during the time of Nazi Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a State of New York Legislative Resolution honoring John R., and an opinion piece, written by John R. for The Generation After , on the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains articles and reviews of book and play based on book, Fragments of Isabella .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings; advertisements for presentations and courses on the Holocaust given by Ilse S.; two poems and two short writs by Ilse S.; an autobiography; photographs of Ilse S.; a map of Judischer Friedhof indicating the locations of family members' graves; correspondence from Congress member Barbara Kennelly, Elie Weiesel of the United States Holocaust Memorial Council, Senator Lowell Weicker, and Sam Goldberger; and a copy of the Congressional Record for October 18, 1988 second session of the 100th Congress in which a poem by Ilse S, in response to President Reagan's visit to Bitburg Cemetery, is published.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photos of Etta W. and her father, and a photocopy of the passport used for her travels to Budapest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter from Henny S. to family members after the liberation, and a memoir about her experiences during the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of 1990 correspondence from Herman B. with Museum of Jewish Heritage/A Living Memorial to the Holocaust regarding documents and art donated to the Leo Baeck Institute and an exhibit of those articles as well as a listing of photographs and documents considered for donation to the Museum of Jewish Heritage. Also contains copy of an article in the New York Daily News , September 18, 1945 about Herman B.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a newspaper clipping on Abraham U.'s experiences during the Holocaust and his return visit to Poland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an interview of Aranka S. on writing books for children about the Holocaust; newpaper clipping on Aranka S.'s books; two copies of publisher advertisements for her books; a copy of a January 18, 1992 issue of Newsweek which includes a review of her book Upon the Head of the Goat ; and a copy of a Fall 1990 Kerlan Collection newsletter that includes an announcement of a public lecture by Aranka S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a collective memoir written by Eva H., her mother and her father.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter from Fred F. to his mother dated May 19, 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a personal narrative regarding Chiel M.'s Holocaust experiences in Poland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains handwritten biographical notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a narrative by Dan G. about the liberation in Seehaupt; photocopied photos of the Hauptbaustelle Flugzeugwerk Mettenheim of Nazi Germany; a photocopied photo of the liberation of Muhldorf; and current group photos of the survivors of the Muhldorf/Seeshaupt death train.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains diary and drawings of Eugene R.'s experiences at Barth Concentration Camp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letters sent by Armand (Abraham) Kahan from train headed to Auschwitz; letter written after the liberation of Auschwitz; letter sent from Katowice; letter sent from Kursk; and a telegram and transport ticket.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a one page article from Newsweek written by Ola S.'s daughter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains five personal narratives written by Sarah M. regarding her experiences in Poland, Paris, and Switzerland during the war of 1939-1944.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an advertisement made by Atlantic Union College of a speaking engagement by John W., and newspaper clippings on John W. and his Dutch-Paris underground organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains John M.'s honorable discharge documents, and photocopies of pages from The Last Offensive, a volume of the series United States Army in World War II, marked to document/validate John M.'s Army experience during WWII.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a personal narrative by Abraham B.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter and drawing of Kulkin's Courtyard that was sent to Ernest Ratowitz about the Ratowiczes and Polish of that area; correspondence between Matthew T. and Joanne Rudof; three versions of a personal narrative by Matthew T. that include photographs and drawings; a photo of artwork by Matthew T.; and a thank you card from the Emanuel Synagogue of West Hartford, Connecticut, featuring artwork by Matthew T. entitled "Shabbat and the Tree of Life" and a booklet explaining the details of the artwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of articles about Madeleine M.; a map; and The Ravensbr√ºck Prayer .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a photocopy of a New York Times article about the Jewish ghetto in Shanghai during World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings about Frank S. and his artwork.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a narrative by Helen S.'s husband about his experiences in the Oswiecim (Auschwitz) Camp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of the Museum of Jewish Heritage Video History Project Questionnaire; photographs of family members; and a memoir of Celina H.'s wartime experiences as a child.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a bound copy of Thomas H.'s memoir, Then, Death Was Decreed , covering his life from 1929 to 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains letter to Anita S.'s cousin from her father in Oranienburg Camp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains intake interview sheet for video testimony; correspondence from Joanne Rufof; and copies of wartime letters written by Phillipe P.'s father.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper story about Erika M., her husband's, and her family's experiences in Slovakia during World War II.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a resume for Lisa O., a German citizen, detailing her guest speaking and authorship experience on the Holocaust. Resume also includes a chronology of Lisa O.'s experiences in Nazi Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an unpublished manuscript of Amelia B.'s life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a newspaper clipping on Kurt L., and an autobiography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an autobiography of Irena D.'s experiences from 1939 to 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a letter in Polish and a translated copy sent from the National Museum in Auschwitz to Joesph Kahn regarding documentation on Kokotek Pesla and her imprisonment in Concentration Camp Oswiecim-Brzezinka (Auschwitz-Birkenau).

did.unittitle: "About the Holocaust, Christian Guilt and Related Issues"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A document/opinion piece written by Herbert L.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A survivor documentary filmed in Auschwitz by Loebel Prod. Inc.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a Spanish booklet entitled "Testimonio" which details Fiszel S.'s experiences during the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence sent from the American Gathering of Jewish Holocaust Survivors to Eva Kor; a page from a register book at Auschwitz; a press release from CANDLES (Children of Auschwitz Nazi's Deadly Lab Experiments Survivors); a memorial pledge by CANDLES; and a list of the surviving Auschwitz/Mengele Twins used in the experiments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a piece written for B'nai B'rith by Joseph T. about his trip back to Poland and his memories of the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a German letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tape of a survivor personal narrative entitled "Esther's Life Story."

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a special issue of Borba , a Serbian newspaper, listing the names of child victims of the Holocaust, and personal narratives of Judita K.'s experiences during the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Military footage showing Jack T. as a little boy.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy of non-commercially produced items for their personal use should consult the ordering reproductions information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains photocopied photographs of classmates and faculty from a Jewish high school in Milan, Italy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains memoir written by John F.'s sister, Helga Harrison, about her experiences in Vienna, her prewar emigration to England, and her current correspondence with individuals she had known during that time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two bound copies of Shmuel Z.'s memoir, translated from Hebrew to English, covering his life from 1928 to 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two papers written by Deitrich G. about the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings; correspondence written between 1939 and 1944 regarding Moses D.'s legal efforts to remove his siblings from foster care; and copies of identification cards/documents 1932-1950.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a summary of Alfred K.'s job history; a copy of his resume; a business card for Alfred K. at Zooba; an autobiography of his life between 1931 and 1951; a copy of remarks made by Alfred K. at the Matzeva unveiling of Peter Goldring in Miami, Florida; and a copy of remarks made by Alfred K. at his own retirement party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a spiral-bound pictorial/prose personal message detailing Peter H.'s Jewish heritage including memorial, history, rabbis, Ahlem, Schusters, Wolfes, and Auschwitz sections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a personal memoir entitled "Surviving Lapac: the true story of one man's escape to freedom," documenting Theodore M.'s experiences during the Holocaust.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a brief autobiography of Alice F.'s life through 1946, and a Reader's Digest article on Ted Aplin and the Bergen-Belsen displaced persons camp.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a CD: "Memories and Dreams: A Holocaust Survivor Remembers. The Poetry of Maria Szapszewicz."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a memoir of Suzanne R.'s experiences through 1950 and her reflections on her trip back to Paris in 2002 and her visiting of locations where she spent time during WWII.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains an excerpt from the introductory chapter of Herman L.'s book Mostly in the Line of Duty: Thirty Years with Books , which details his experiences as a prisoner during WWII.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clipping featuring a photograph of the family business, and correspondence from the Stiftung Dokumentationsarchiv detailing what happened to her mother and sister.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of Alex P.'s plays and memoirs regarding his experiences during WWII, and a written work documenting the lives of eighteen family members who died in 1944 in German concentration camps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains DVD of Luna H.'s photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains copies of a biographical essay by Alice R. dated August 24, 2003,and a family history essay by her grandson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings; a photocopy of the cover of a 1947-1948 issue of "Who's Who Among North American Esperantists" with a brief biography of Ernest K.'s father; a brief autobiography written in German; and a copy of his father's Maccabi identification.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Eva G.'s Deutsches Reich Arbeitsbuch (work book); and her mother's Deutsches Reich Kennkarte (identity card).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings; program and inserts from the Rivkah Laufer Bikur Cholim Annual Luncheon; and publicity by Fran L. regarding her upcoming book The Sacred Covenant .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains notice of an exhibit of photographs of the Bergen-Belsen Displaced Persons Camp at Beth Radom congregation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a handwritten, brief autobiography; an edited and updated copy of a transcript of an interview by the Jewish Historical Society of Hartford; and a bound copy of Hyman K.'s personal memoir, entitled "An Unusual Escape to Freedom," documenting his experiences from 1925-1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a French document about the experiences of Belgian Jews during WWII, and an English copy of a 1971 speech made in French by Lucien Steinberg about the participation of Jews in the Allied Armies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two copies of a personal memoir regarding Hannelore H.'s family's arrest, in March 1943, by the Nazis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains printout from Gerald F.'s website featuring his diary entries during WWII, and a copy of an SEPM Foundation publication, Saxa Loquntur (Rocks Speak): The Life and Times of the Geologist Gerald M. Friedman .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains two copies of a publication by The Manhattan College Holocaust Center entitled, Reflections of the Soul: Martin Spett's Holocaust Experiences .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of the preface and Appendix A from Franco Modigliani: A Mind That Never Rests .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a copy of a scanned Westchester Jewish Chronicle newspaper photograph of Jewish partisans from Vilna after the city's liberation; 3 copies of a scanned photograph of the living quarters of the Jewish Partisans in the Rudnicki Forest south of Vilna.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Holocaust-related printed ephemera not associated with specific testimonies
Kampf um's Dritte Reich: Eine Historische Bilderfolge , cigarette card album

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nazi-era propaganda album owned by Gustav Wollschind (?), containing photographs and cigarette cards depicting Adolf Hitler, other National Socialist leaders, and scenes depicting rallies and war preparations. In German.

did.unittitle: Printed ephemera relating to Jews in Nazi-era and post-war Germany

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains identification documents from Landsberg Displaced Persons Camp for Josef Wajsman; Deutsches Reich Reisepass (identification paper) for Siegfried Risewz, stamped with a red J to identify the bearer as a Jew; postal receipt document from Bonn.

did.unittitle: Journal or story of emigration to Israel (photocopy), title (stenciled) and handwritten marginalia in Hebrew, text written in Hungarian (32 pages)
Letters (photocopies) in German dealing with transports and other topics, written to the Raab family
